page.title: 16TOURISM - General
page.content: The area caters mainly for people who wish to walk, fish,or visit places of interest within driving distance, or partake in water sports. For walking the area is used as a base and people will travel as far afield as the Lake District, the N Yorks Moors or the Northumbrian coast. There is good walking locally on the moors. Many people come to see the Blue Gentian flowers peculiar to the area in Upper Teesdale and to walk the Durham - Cumbria section of the Pennine Way. Places of major interest in the village are the site of a medieval castle and an old water mill and the confluence of the Balder and Tees rivers. To those who can find accommodation in the village it is possible to travel a radius of some 70-80 miles to places of interest.
